ServiceWorkerRegistration.summary: The ServiceWorkerRegistration interface of the Service Worker API represents the service worker registration. You register a service worker to control one or more pages that share the same origin.

remarks.para: The lifetime of a service worker registration is beyond that of the ServiceWorkerRegistration objects that represent them within the lifetime of their corresponding service worker clients. The browser maintains a persistent list of active ServiceWorkerRegistration objects.

-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationActive.summary:
The active read-only property of the
interface returns a service worker whose
is activating or activated.
This property is initially set to null.

remarks.para:
An active worker controls a if the client's URL
falls within the scope of the registration (the scope option set when
is first called.)

blockquote.para:
Once an active worker is activating, neither a
runtime script error nor a force termination of the active worker prevents the active
worker from getting activated.

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationActive.value:
A object's property, if it is currently in an
activating or activated state.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationBackgroundFetch.summary:
NOTE Experimental The backgroundFetch read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to a
object, which can be used to initiate background fetch operations.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationCookies.summary: The cookies read-only property of the interface returns a reference to the interface, which enables a web app to subscribe to and unsubscribe from cookie change events in a service worker. This is an entry point for the Cookie Store API.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationGetNotification.summary:
The getNotifications() method of
the interface returns a list of the
notifications in the order that they were created from the current origin via the
current service worker registration. Origins can have many active but
differently-scoped service worker registrations. Notifications created by one service
worker on the same origin will not be available to other active service workers on
that same origin.
ServiceWorkerRegistrationGetNotification.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves to a list of objects.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationIndex.summary:
NOTE Experimental The index read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to the
interface, which allows for indexing of offline content.

remarks.para:
-Content Index API
-An introductory article on the Content Index API

ServiceWorkerRegistrationInstalling.summary:
The installing read-only property of the
interface returns a service worker whose
is installing. This property is
initially set to null.

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationInstalling.value:
A object, if it is currently in an installing
state.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationNavigationPrelo.summary: The navigationPreload read-only property of the interface returns the associated with the current service worker registration.

remarks.para: The returned object allows resources managed by a service worker to be preemptively downloaded in parallel with service worker boot up.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationPaymentManager.summary:
NOTE Experimental The paymentManager read-only property of the
interface returns a payment app's instance, which is used to manage various payment app functionality.

remarks.para:
-{{domxref("Payment Handler API", "", "", "nocode")}}
-Web-based payment apps overview
-Setting up a payment method
-Life of a payment transaction
-Using the Payment Request API
-Payment processing concepts

ServiceWorkerRegistrationPeriodicSync.summary:
NOTE Experimental The periodicSync read-only property of
the interface returns a reference to the
interface, which allows for registering of tasks to
run at specific intervals.

remarks.para: -Richer offline experiences with the Periodic Background Sync API

ServiceWorkerRegistrationPushManager.summary:
The pushManager read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to the
interface for managing push subscriptions; this includes
support for subscribing, getting an active subscription, and accessing push permission
status.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationScope.summary: The scope read-only property of the interface returns a string representing a URL that defines a service worker's registration scope; that is, the range of URLs a service worker can control. This is set using the scope parameter specified in the call to which registered the service worker.

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationScope.value: Returns a string representing a URL that defines a service worker's registration scope.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationShowNotificatio.summary:
The showNotification() method of the
interface creates a notification on an active
service worker.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationSync.summary:
The sync read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to the
interface, which manages background synchronization
processes.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUnregister.summary:
The unregister() method of the
interface unregisters the service worker
registration and returns a . The promise will resolve to
false if no registration was found, otherwise it resolves to
true irrespective of whether unregistration happened or not (it may not
unregister if someone else just called
with the same scope.) The service worker will finish any ongoing operations before it is
unregistered.

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUnregister.returns:
resolves with a boolean indicating whether the service worker has
unregistered or not.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUpdate.summary:
The update() method of the
interface attempts to update the service
worker. It fetches the worker's script URL, and if the new worker is not byte-by-byte
identical to the current worker, it installs the new worker. The fetch of the worker
bypasses any browser caches if the previous fetch occurred over 24 hours ago.

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUpdate.returns:
A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a
object.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUpdatefound.summary:
The updatefound event of the
interface is fired any time the property acquires a new service worker.

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUpdateViaCache.summary: The updateViaCache read-only property of the interface returns the value of the setting used to determine the circumstances in which the browser will consult the HTTP cache when it tries to update the service worker or any scripts that are imported via .

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationUpdateViaCache.value: Returns one of the following values:

ServiceWorkerRegistrationWaiting.summary:
The waiting read-only property of the
interface returns a service worker whose
is installed. This property is initially
set to null.

remarks.para:
-Using Service Workers
-Service workers basic code example
-Using web workers

ServiceWorkerRegistrationWaiting.value:
A object, if it is currently in an installed
state.
